perturbation.original_text: Bizzingo agrees to defend, indemnify, and hold Theismann harmless against all costs, expenses, and losses (including reasonable attorney fees and costs) incurred through claims of third parties against Theismann based on the manufacture or sale of the  Network including, but not limited to, actions founded on network liability. In this regarding, within thirty (30) days from the  execution of this Agreement, Bizzingo will secure an insurance policy with limits of $5,000,000 per event and $ 5,000,000 umbrella,  naming Theismann as an additional insured, covering the losses and claims stated in this sub-paragraph d.
perturbation.changed_text: Bizzingo agrees to defend, indemnify, and hold Theismann harmless against all costs, expenses, and losses incurred through claims of third parties against Theismann based on the manufacture or sale of the Network including, but not limited to, actions founded on network liability.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the requirement for Bizzingo to secure a $5,000,000 insurance policy naming Theismann as an additional insured, the contract removes a significant financial protection for Theismann. If Bizzingo fails to secure such insurance, Theismann is more vulnerable to financial loss from claims. This creates a legal contradiction with general principles of corporate liability and duty of care, potentially exposing Theismann to uncovered losses if a claim exceeds Bizzingo's ability to pay, a standard insurance coverage that protects the consumer (Theismann in this case).
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of corporate liability and duty of care, as well as potential breaches of fiduciary duty if Bizzingo's negligence in maintaining adequate insurance harms Theismann.

perturbation.original_text: Following the execution of this Agreement, Theismann will provide Bizzingo with an availability schedule  indicating black out and/or available dates and from time to time will endeavor to update such schedule. In this regard, Bizzingo agrees to provide  Joseph Theismann with at least thirty (30) days' written notice of any photographic sessions or public appearances to permit Theismann to  properly schedule the session or appearance. Bizzingo will pay all reasonable out of pocket expenses incurred by Theismann in connection with  such session or appearance which expenses shall not exceed One Thousand Dollars ($1,000) per day unless Theismann receives prior written  approval from Bizzingo. For any travel incurred by Theismann as part of his appearances, Bizzingo will provide first class air travel and hotel  accommodations.
perturbation.changed_text: Following the execution of this Agreement, Theismann will provide Bizzingo with an availability schedule indicating black out and/or available dates and from time to time will endeavor to update such schedule. Bizzingo will pay reasonable out of pocket expenses incurred by Theismann in connection with such session or appearance. For any travel incurred by Theismann as part of his appearances, Bizzingo will provide air travel and hotel accommodations.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the requirements that Bizzingo provides at least thirty (30) days' written notice of any sessions or appearances and the limit of one thousand dollars for expenses introduces legal risk. By omitting the notice period, Theismann has less time to prepare, potentially impacting his reputation if he is unprepared. Also, the cap on daily expenses is gone, making Theismann to bear additional costs. This omission introduces a legal risk by contradicting the duty of good faith and fair dealing, which requires parties to a contract to act honestly and reasonably. It also removes a defined parameter which could lead to possible disputes, and potential financial repercussions for Theismann.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing; principles of contract law requiring clarity and definiteness in terms.

perturbation.changed_text: The securities represented by this certificate have been acquired for investment and may be offered for sale, hypothecated, sold or transferred.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the restrictive legend detailing the limitations of transfer under the United States Securities Act of 1933, the contract now implies that the securities can be freely traded. This omission removes legally mandated disclosures and restrictions, creating a legal risk for Theismann if he believes he can freely trade the securities and violates securities regulations.
